citation.article-title: Olivibacter oleidegradans sp. nov., a hydrocarbon-degrading bacterium isolated from a biofilter clean-up facility on a hydrocarbon-contaminated site
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Olivibacter oleidegradans sp. nov.

Olivibacter oleidegradans [o.le.i.de.gra′dans. L. n. oleum oil; L. part. adj. degradans returning to the original order, referring to the ability of the type strain to degrade oil (hydrocarbons); N.L. part. adj. oleidegradans capable of degrading oil (hydrocarbons)].
Cells are Gram-negative, obligately aerobic, non-spore-forming, non-motile rods (0.6×1.8–2.0 µm) that lack flagella.
Colonies grown on R2A agar plates are smooth, circular, convex, non-luminescent, opaque and yellowish after 5 days at 30 °C.
Good growth is observed on TGE agar, TSA and nutrient agar but not on MacConkey agar.
Growth is observed at 15–45 °C and at pH 6.0–9.0.
Optimal growth occurs at 30–37 °C and pH 6.5–7.0.
Unable to grow in the presence of 2 % NaCl.

Assimilates amygdalin, arbutin, d-adonitol, d-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-glucose, lactose, d-lyxose, maltose, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, d-ribose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, aesculin, l-arabinose, l-rhamnose, gluconate, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, salicin and trypsin.

Positive for acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.

Negative reactions are observed for gelatin hydrolysis, urease, Tween hydrolysis, leucine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), β-glucuronidase and α-fucosidase and for assimilation of adipate, malonate, caprate, citrate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, d-arabitol, d-fucose, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, d-tagatose, dulcitol, erythritol, phenylacetate, gentiobiose, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, itaconate, lactate, l-alanine, l-fucose, l-histidine, l-proline, l-serine, l-sorbose, l-xylose, 2-keto-d-gluconate, potassium 5-ketogluconate, l-proline, propionate, suberate, valerate and xylitol.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, summed feature 3 (iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c), iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and C16 : 0.
Menaquinone 7 (MK-7) is the predominant respiratory quinone; MK-6 is present as a minor component.
Phosphatidylethanolamine, two aminophospholipids, three phospholipids, four lipids and an atypical glycolipid are present as polar lipids.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 41.2 mol%.
The type strain, TBF2/20.2T ( = NCAIMB 02393T = CCM 7765T), was isolated from an on-site, ex situ groundwater-cleaning biofilter facility on a former airbase in Hungary.
